forecaster.forecast.base module¶

This module provides a Forecast class for use in forecasts.

This is where most of the financial forecasting logic of the Forecaster package lives. It applies Scenario, Strategy, and Tax information to determine how account balances will grow or shrink year-over-year.

class forecaster.forecast.base.Forecast(income_forecast, living_expenses_forecast, saving_forecast, withdrawal_forecast, tax_forecast, scenario)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.ledger.base.Ledger

A financial forecast spanning multiple years.

A Forecast is a container for various *Forecast objects, such as IncomeForecast and WithdrawalForecast. Those objects contain various Account objects with balances that grow (or shrink) from year to year, Person objects describing the plannees, Scenario information describing economic conditions over the course of the forecast, and Strategy objects to describe the plannees’ behaviour.

Forecast provides a high-level model for annual cashflows as they relate to retirement savings. In particular, it uses this model:

  • Determine total (net) income for the year.

  • Determine the portion of net income used for ordinary living expenses. This is the pool of money available for retirement savings and lifecycle expenses.

    Deducting living expenses from income yields “gross contributions” - the total amount available to be saved.

  • Determine the portion of available money which will be used on “lifecycle” expenses. These are expenditures on top of ordinary living expenses which vary over time. Inflows to retirement savings accounts are reduced to pay for these. This can include, e.g., childcare, contributions to education accounts, home purchase costs, debt repayment, and so on.

    Where lifecycle expenses involve contributions to non-retirement accounts (like education savings accounts or debt accounts), per-account contributions are also determined at this step.

    Deducting lifecycle expenses from gross contributions yields “net contributions” - the total amount actually saved.

  • Determine per-account retirement contributions based on net contributions.

  • Determine the amount withdrawn from retirement savings accounts. Allocate portions of that to each retirement account.

  • Determine total tax liability for the year; if necessary, adjust withdrawals accordingly and repeat.

  • Determine statistics for the year (e.g. living standard.)

The Forecast can be built around any number of people, but is ordinarily built around either a single person or a spousal couple (since spouses have specific tax treatment). Otherwise, it’s better practice to build separate Forecast objects for separate people.

Note that each of the below Money attributes has an associated dict[int, Money] that stores the value of the attribute for each year of the forecast. (Key values are years.) The dicts are named *_history; e.g. income is associated with income_history and income_history[2001] gives the value of income for year 2001.

income_forecast¶

A callable object that takes a cashflow time series (called available) and mutates it to include net income for each year.

Type

IncomeForecast

living_expenses_forecast¶

A callable object that takes a cashflow time series (called available) and mutates it to include ordinary living expenses for each year.

Type

LivingExpensesForecast

saving_forecast¶

A callable object that takes a cashflow time series (called available) and mutates it to include amounts contributed to savings for each year.

Type

SavingForecast

withdrawal_forecast¶

A callable object that takes a cashflow time series (called available) and mutates it to include total withdrawals for each year.

Type

WithdrawalForecast

tax_forecast¶

A callable object that takes a cashflow time series (called available) and mutates it to include total taxes owed within the each year, if any. It also provides attributes which help Forecast to determine whether any tax liability should be reflected in next year’s cashflow.

Type

TaxForecast

scenario¶

Economic information for the forecast (e.g. inflation and stock market returns for each year)

Type

Scenario

income¶

The net income for the plannees for the year.

Type

Money

living_expenses¶

The amount that the plannees live off of for the year.

Type

Money

gross_contributions¶

The amount available to contribute to savings, before any reductions. This is the amount left over after living expenses.

Type

Money

contribution_reductions¶

Amounts diverted from savings, such as certain debt repayments or childcare.

Type

Money

net_contributions¶

The total amount contributed to savings accounts for the year.

Type

Money

principal¶

The total value of all savings accounts (but not other property) at the start of the year.

Type

Money

withdrawals¶

The total amount withdrawn from all accounts for the year.

Type

Money

tax¶

The total tax liability for the year (some of which might not be payable unti the next year). Does not include tax liability from previous years which is paid in this year, but does include tax liability arising in this year which won’t be repaid until a future year.

Type

Money

__init__(income_forecast, living_expenses_forecast, saving_forecast, withdrawal_forecast, tax_forecast, scenario)[source]¶

Constructs an instance of class Forecast.

Parameters

  • income_forecast (IncomeForecast) – Determines net income for each year.

  • living_expenses_forecast (LivingExpensesForecast) – Determines the living expenses for each year.

  • saving_forecast (SavingForecast) – Determines the savings for each year.

  • withdrawal_forecast (WithdrawalForecast) – Determines the total withdrawals for each year.

  • tax_forecast (TaxForecast) – Determines taxes owed for the year.

  • scenario (Scenario) – Provides initial_year and num_year properties.

property assets¶

A set of non-Debt Account objects for the forecast.

call_subforecasts()[source]¶

Calls each SubForecast in order.

property debts¶

A set of Debt objects for the forecast.

property income

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

property income_history¶

Record of income over all past years.

property living_expenses

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

property living_expenses_history¶

Record of living_expenses over all past years.

next_year()[source]¶

Adds a year to the forecast.

property people¶

The Person plannees for the forecast.

property principal

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

property principal_history¶

Record of principal over all past years.

property retirement_year¶

Determines the retirement year for the plannees.

TODO: This approach forces Forecast to assume that all plannees retire at the same time, which is often inaccurate. We should use per-retiree retirement dates, meaning that this method should be removed and the calling code refactored.

property savings¶

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

property savings_history¶

Record of savings over all past years.

property tax

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

property tax_history¶

Record of tax over all past years.

property withdrawals

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

property withdrawals_history¶

Record of withdrawals over all past years.
